result.execSummary:
The defendant Alice M Herbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alice M Herbert in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is asking for restitution in the amount of $400.00 for extradition fees. Defense has no objection. Court orders restitution be set at $400.00 for extradition fees.  Defense requests that the defendant serve her sentence in Milwaukee County. Court grants request. Court orders no electronic monitoring. Amended Judgment of Conviction to be prepared.
Restitution hearing on May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Alice M Herbert did not appear at 2:12 p.m..   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only. Case recalled. Defendant is now present. Court quashes the capias (not issued). Court reinstates bail (not forfeited). Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 3 Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution hearing set
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with Sara S. or any Best Buy whatsoever. Criminal Thinking if deemed necessary by Agent.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the fine and costs as a condition of probation.
 -  135 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 05/08/2015 by 6:00 p.m..  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  Last 15 days jail  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
